definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
in a whisper/in a low voice (idiom)

sentences.english: Shawn boomed. "There is endless bounty there for both of us.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩低声说，“那儿会给我们俩无尽的礼物。

sentences.english: The dog whined to go out with us.
sentences.chinese: 狗低声哀叫，意思是想和我们一起出去。

sentences.english: Mrs. Thompson, with tears in her eyes, whispered back.
sentences.chinese: 汤普生太太，她眼中的泪水，低声说回来。

sentences.english: The audience even crooned to the rhythm of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 台下的听众跟着歌声低声吟唱。
她忧郁地低声说道，“我们得付392块钱。”

sentences.english: "Ser Robert, " Cersei whispered, as they entered the gates.
sentences.chinese: “劳勃爵士，”当他们进门的时候，瑟曦低声说。

sentences.english: Prince Aribert whispered under his breath.
I can hear a knot of people whisper in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见一小群人在隔壁低声细语。

sentences.english: You will just have to grovel to the bank manager for a loan .
sentences.chinese: 你只得低声下气地向银行经理借贷。

sentences.english: Sydney murmured the question to herself as she yanked a thick sweater over her head.
sentences.chinese: 悉妮迅速穿好一件套头厚毛衣，低声问自己。

sentences.english: I see unquiet ghosts and speak their whispered tongue.
sentences.chinese: 我看见动荡的鬼魂和他们低声的耳语。

sentences.english: When I listen to the ocean, it will be your whispers;
sentences.chinese: 当我聆听大海时，会发现那是你的低声细语。

sentences.english: I crept back to bed, but was awakened later by low voices saying good-bye.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄溜回床上，但是后来被低声的告别声绘吵醒。

sentences.english: His low voice's mentioning, that chopsticks also lightly ran into expensive rare twice of lipses.
sentences.chinese: 他低声的说着，那筷子也轻轻碰到了贵生的双唇。

sentences.english: A bleating sheep loses a bite.
sentences.chinese: 一只低声叫的羊躲过了被咬。

definition: in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to turn around
